page.title: 18BIOGRAPHY_EMMA'S AFTERNOON.
page.content: After our dinner it was time for play and then my Mum drove Lisa, Paul and I to St. Wilfred's School in Ventnor for our violin lesson. When we got back to school all the class were working on our Domesday 1985 Project. We have made maps showing the land cover, and also written about lives and families. At 3 o'clock it was time to go home and I went out to play on my roller boots. I came back at tea time and had cheese and chutney sandwiches, cake and a cup of tea. My twin brother Justin and I watched "Street Hawk" on television - that was the programme he chose, but most of my friends were watching "Blue Peter". This is a magazine programme for children and every year it organises a charity collection to help children in other countries. At 8.30 I went to bed.
